title: About
text:
This is Tina Tsai’s profile.

hist(mtcars$mpg)

title: Tina Tsai
text:
Hi, I’m Tina! I recently earned my Master’s degree in Business Analytics and AI from The University of Texas at Dallas, following a solid foundation in Statistics and Information Science from Fu Jen Catholic University.
My journey in data is driven by a simple belief:
Data is more than just numbers; it’s a way to tell stories and support meaningful decisions.
Through my academic and project experiences, I have developed a robust toolkit in Python, R, and SQL, alongside visualization expertise in Tableau and Power BI.



Beyond the Data: I am an avid traveler and a dedicated reader.
For me, exploring a new city and diving into a complex dataset share the same thrill—the joy of discovering hidden patterns and understanding diverse systems. I bring this same curiosity and “never-stop-learning” attitude to every project I take on.


  
    
      
      Observing real-world systems
    

    
      
      Building structured thinking
    

    
      
      Turning patterns into decisions

title: Movie Review Sentiment Analysis & AI Chatbot
About
text:
This is Tina Tsai’s profile.

hist(mtcars$mpg)

title: Tina Tsai
text:
Hi, I’m Tina Tsai. I recently graduated from the University of Texas at Dallas with a degree in Business Analytics & AI. I enjoy reading and traveling, and I believe that real learning comes from both knowledge and experience. I love discovering new things through hands-on work—especially when uncovering meaningful patterns and insights from data.


  
  
  


I build dashboards, clustering/NLP models, and forecasting & optimization solutions using Python, SQL, and Power BI. I enjoy translating data into clear, actionable decisions. Explore my projects and resume below.

title: Project Experience
text:
A selection of analytics, visualization, and data-driven projects,
with a focus on translating complex data into clear, actionable decisions.




Movie Review Sentiment Analysis & AI Chatbot


KNIME Text Analysis Gen AI



Analyzed 2,200+ movie reviews using KNIME to identify 4 key market themes via word cloud analysis.


Built a sentiment model achieving 64% accuracy to automate audience feedback monitoring and support brand perception analysis.


Integrated Generative AI to develop a chatbot that answers user queries about movie reviews and evaluations.





Campus Safety Optimization (Microsoft Project)


Power BI Data Cleaning Storytelling



Analyzed 500+ stakeholder feedback records to identify operational inefficiencies and resource gaps in campus safety services.


Proposed a data-driven solution leveraging Azure and Microsoft Teams for real-time location tracking and incident reporting.


Designed an interactive Power BI dashboard to visualize findings and deliver actionable insights to stakeholders.



Role: Microsoft Student Ambassador (Cohort 2, Fall 2025)




Utilizing Big Data to Study the Potential Risk Factors in Human Liver Cancer


R ANOVA Mann–Whitney U tests Statistical Methods



Analyzed data from 600 individuals using R to identify key risk factors associated with liver cancer.


Applied statistical methodologies including ANOVA and Mann–Whitney U tests to determine 3 statistically significant risk drivers.





Predicting Air Quality in Taiwan


Python (scikit-learn, pandas) Random Forest SVM



Built predictive models using Python (scikit-learn, pandas) to forecast air quality levels with 79% accuracy, utilizing algorithms such as Random Forest and SVM for performance benchmarking.


Designed a database-backed data pipeline to support data ingestion, cleaning, and analysis for air quality forecasting.





2025 DataWhiz Data Visualization Competition


Power BI Visualization Business Insight



Processed and cleaned 88.3K data points to ensure data accuracy and integrity across multiple sources.


Developed interactive Power BI dashboards and presented actionable insights to faculty, improving interpretation of analytical results.







Leadership & Activities


Taiwanese Student Association (UT Dallas) — Vice President


Leadership Event Operations Community Building



Led planning and coordination for student organization events.


Improved communication and execution quality across teams.



:::

title: Tina Tsai
text:
Hi, I’m Tina Tsai — a Data Analyst with a background in Business Analytics & AI. I enjoy traveling and reading, not just as hobbies, but as ways to observe people, systems, and patterns beyond data.


I believe meaningful insights come from combining analytical rigor with real-world curiosity.


  
    
      
      Observing real-world systems
    

    
      
      Building structured thinking
    

    
      
      Turning patterns into decisions
    
  


I build dashboards, clustering & NLP models, and forecasting and optimization solutions using Python, SQL, and Power BI.


I enjoy translating data into clear, actionable decisions.
